titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the George Constantine Guins papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-22T16:04-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised to change instances to microfilm and move Box/Folder information to Scope and Contents notes.
Revised to add microfilm reel information, updating Museum of Russian Culture microfilm, adding reel contents guide.
Added biographical information from Hoover website.
Updated restriction statement, edited date, and combined dscs.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::George Constantine Guins Papers)//EN" "guinsgeo.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 9 microfilm reels

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, notes, reports, declarations, and printed matter relating to the Russian Revolution and Civil War in the Siberian Far East, activities of anti-Bolshevik forces in Siberia, Japanese intervention, and the history, culture and legal systems of Russia and the Soviet Union. Includes biographical data on members of the Guins family.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: In part, originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual or digital material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George Constantine Guins papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Entered government service, Resettlement Office of Ministry of Agriculture
Chief Legal Counselor, Ministry of Provisions

Manager of Affairs, Siberian (later All-Russian) Provisional Government (also held positions of Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs and Assistant Minister of Education, Chairman of State Economic Council)
Service on administration of Chinese Eastern Railway as Head of Chancellery and later Chief Controller
Author, Obosnovanie politiki prava v trudakh Professora L.I. Petrazhitskogo
Author, Novye idei v prave i osnovnye problemy sovremennosti
Author, Uchenie o prave i politicheskaia ekonomiia
Consultant, Voice of America, United States Information Agency

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection consists mainly of the speeches, writings and lectures of George C. Guins for his Ã©migrÃ© period.

The collection contains important biographical material, including his third person autobiography and oral history interviews. Also of particular significance are his unpublished book manuscripts on the development of Russian history and culture, as well as on his academic specialty - legal theory.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials and copyright to them (with some exceptions) are the property of the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 37 photographs / 1 envelope. 2 prints of Admiral Aleksandr K. Kolchak; 1 print of General Mikhail K. Dietrichs; 1 print of General Jan Syrovy; 1 print of P. V. Vologodskago; 1 print of Ivan I. Serebrennikov; 1 print of Lev M. Mikhailov; 1 print of Zefirov; 1 print of Steponenkol 1 print of Gudkov; 1 print of Gratsianov; 1 print of Shchmelovsky; 1 print of Sapoznikov; 1 print of Potushchapsky; 2 unidentified prints of people; 22 prints of scenes in Siberia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Razvitie Bol'shevizma na Dal'nem Vostoke: Ocherk po materialam inspektsii Kraevoi militisii pri Verkhovnom upolnomochennom Rossiiskogo Pravitel'stva na Dal'nem Vostoke. Edited by Colonel von Arnold. Vladivostok, May 1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Personal and financial papers, identity documents, oral history interviews, autobiographical notes and correspondence, bibliography of works, farewell addresses, arranged alphabetically by physical form. See also: Speeches and Writings and Oversize File.

On the occasion of leaving the service of the Chinese Eastern Railroad (in Chinese),
On the occasion of the tenth anniversary of Guins's teaching political economy at the First Harbin Public Commercial School,
Correspondence relating biographical information for oral history project,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letters to director of UC Berkeley Regional Oral History Office Willa Baum and interviewer Boris Raymond.

did.unittitle: Oral history projects conducted by the Regional Oral History Office of the University of California, Berkeley
George C. Guins: Impressions of the Russian Imperial Government (Berkeley, CA: University of California Regional Oral History Office),
George C. Guins, Professor and Government Official: Russia, China and California. An Interview Conducted by Boris Raymond (Berkeley, CA: University of California Regional Oral History Office),

Miscellaneous documents, including travel certificates, identity papers, power of attorney forms and a contract form (typescript, apparently drawn up by Guins), service and financial records (in Russian and Chinese, with attached photographs),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeches, drafts of articles and books, offprints, reviews and related correspondence, arranged chronologically and by title thereunder.

did.unittitle: Works on the Russian Civil War and Allied intervention, typescript (in Russian and English),
Work(s) on the Slav question at the close of World War II, typescript,
Research materials on Soviet law, holograph and typescript,
"Aggression - A Challenge to the U.N.," typescript,
"Anglichanin o russkikh i o sovetskoi zhizni," typescript,
"Beloe dvizhenie," background material, notes, related fragments and typescript (incomplete), including early draft(s),
"Chego strana zhdet ot Aika Eisenhauera?," typescript,
"The Fateful Events of the W. W. II," notes and typescript,
"The Influence of Social Culture on Human Behavior," typescript,
"Iron Curtain Laws and Convictions by False Confessions," typescript,
"Legal Policy (Principles of Legislation and Administration)" [See: "Politika prava (osnovy zakonodatel'stva i upravleniia)," undated]
"Obedinennye natsii i prezident de Goll'," typescript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes background material, notes, and drafts of a proposed book. Materials have been left in original order, which may or may not reflect author's order, with the exception of placement of table of contents at beginning. Some of the content is in the form of a revised draft of material previously published. Includes early titles and/or drafts of sections entitled "Psikhologicheskaia teoriia prava," "Sotsial'naia psikhologiia i pravo," and "Sotsiologicheskie i psikhologicheskie predposylki novykh idei v prave," 1933; notes for speech entitled "Sotsial'naia psikhologiia i osnovy prava," 1936 September 8, before the Kharbinskii Iuridicheskii Fakul'tet, Harbin, China; and news clipping summarizing speech ( Gun-Bao, 9 September 1936).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of incomplete Russian original, with drafts of material re-used from published works, as well as drafts of English translations entitled "Legal Policy (Principles of Legislation and Administration)," and "Law Making as a Science."

did.unittitle: Review of Harry Braverman, The Future of Russia, typescript,
Review of Ivo Lapenna, State and Law: Soviet and Yugoslav Theory, typescript,
Review of M. G. Levin and L. P. Potapov, editors, The Peoples of Siberia, typescript,
Review of William Petersen, ed., The Realities of World Communism, typescript,
"Russia's and Soviet Culture (A Philosophy of Russian History)," typescript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incomplete work consisting of background notes, partial table of contents, preface (in Russian and two English versions), early drafts of chapters V ("Mongol'skaia imperiia," with fragment in English) and VII ("The New Generation" - chapter XXII in the final draft), and a section entitled "Part III: Soviet Culture" (chapter XII through conclusion).

did.unittitle: "Russkaia revoliutsiia v plane mirovoi istorii," typescript,
"Soiuzniki i Rossiia v gody revoliutsii," notes, early drafts, fragments and typescript (incomplete),
"Sotsialisticheskaia zakonnost'," typescript and abridged English translation ("Socialist Legality"),
"Sotsial'naia psikhologiia i pravo" [See: "Obshchaia teoriia prava," undated]
"Ukraina posle revoliutsii," research notes and typescript,

Untitled draft of book(s) on development of USSR in the post-World War II period (industry, society, law, ideology, constitutional and political issues), holograph and typescript (in Russian and English),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

"The Degeneration of 'Pan-Slavism'," American Journal of Economics and Sociology,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "The Politics of 'Pan-Slavism'," American Journal of Economics and Sociology, 1949 January and "The Prospects of 'Pan-Slavism'," American Journal of Economics and Sociology, 1950 July, printed copies. Also includes two typed drafts (one incomplete) of the entire work in English under the title "The Slav Question" and one typed draft in Russian, "Slavianskii vopros" (also entitled "Chapter XIV").

"A Ray of Light in the Realm of Darkness," typescript,
Soviet Law and Soviet Society, The Hague, typescript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lecture notes, reading lists, examination questions, background material, rolls and syllabi, arranged chronologically by period and alphabetically by physical form and course title thereunder.

did.unittitle: "Programma. Literatura po grazhdanskomu pravu," typescript and printed matter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reading lists and lectures on special legal issues (tort law, absolute rights, property and family law) as well as articles on legal matters by Guins published earlier.

Slavic 180A-180B, 181 (lectures on Russian and Soviet history and culture),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes background notes, research materials, literature summaries and reviews, examination questions, student rolls and related printed matter (pages torn from Russian calendars, book reviews and articles clipped from various newspapers and journals).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes background notes, research materials, literature summaries and reviews, examination questions, student rolls and related printed matter (pages torn from Russian calendars, book reviews and articles clipped from various newspapers and journals).

did.unittitle: Political Science 116 (lectures on Russian and Soviet law) and Political Science 141 (lectures on Soviet Government),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes background notes, research materials, literature summaries and reviews, examination questions, student rolls and related printed matter (pages torn from Russian calendars, book reviews and articles clipped from various newspapers and journals). Also includes The Challenge: Bulletin of the Association of Former Political Prisoners of Soviet Labor Camps, Vol. I, #1 (July 1950).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appeals, by-laws, correspondence, notes, statutes, clippings and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject.

Orthodox Church in America. Appeals to Ninth and Tenth American Councils,
